headline: Creamiest Rice Pudding
description: This cold rice pudding is cooked on the stove, enriched with eggs and vanilla, then refrigerated overnight before serving.

video.name: How to Make the Creamiest Rice Pudding

name: Creamiest Rice Pudding

recipeInstructions.text: In a large saucepan over medium-low heat, combine 1/2 gallon milk, sugar and rice. Simmer, covered, 1 hour, stirring frequently. Remove pan from heat and let rest 10 minutes.
In a small bowl, combine eggs, 1/4 cup milk, salt and vanilla.
Stir into rice mixture and return pot to low heat, stirring constantly, for 2 minutes.
Pour into a 9x13 inch dish and cover with plastic wrap, folding back the corners to allow the steam to escape.
When pudding has cooled to room temperature, remove plastic wrap and sprinkle surface of pudding with cinnamon. Cover tightly (with fresh wrap) and refrigerate 8 hours or overnight before serving.

review.reviewBody: Loved this recipe. Luckily rice pudding freezes well since it is just the 2 of us.
Excellent recipe! Reminds me of old school diner rice pudding I‚Äôd have as a kid! A+

This is the best rice pudding recipe that I recall from my G-ma. Used white long grain rice, and made sure to bring whole milk to full boil before adding rice, then lowered heat and kept pot covered between stirring. Be patient and you will find the thickness increases if it cooks longer than 1 hour ( if it looks runny). It does not thicken as it cools like other puddings. I like a sprinkle of nutmeg with cinnamon on top and for company a dollop of whipped cream. Make the day before and allow to chill. Comfort food!

I make this recipe but a Little different. I use 1/2 gal whole milk and a pint of heavy cream along with 3 cinnamon sticks and vanilla and sugar. Cook for about 1 and 1/2 hours stirring constantly when it gets thicker I add two beaten eggs. Pour in Pyrex dish and sprinkle with cinnamon before serving. Be sure to throw out the cinnamon sticks. My family favorite.

Being diabetic, I used Greek yogurt and water for some of the milk (protein helps offset carbs) and Swerve for the sugar. Used leftover rice that definitely sucked up the liquid so it was setup and gorgeous after the hour in the pot. Temper the eggs, of course. The cinnamon, raisins and chopped apples added last in the pot, then choc chips to finish. Best rice pudding I‚Äôve ever made.
This is awesome I make it all the time. It is just like grandma use to make. Now my Grandson loves it and wants me to make it tonight. Thank You.
Delicious!!! I did heavy cream for the 1/4 w egg mix, Arborio rice/ Cooke like 1.5 hrs and with 2 cinnamon sticks! Had warm bc I couldn‚Äôt wait!!!

This is my granddaughter‚Äôs absolute favorite recipe so I make sure she has it at every special gathering!! I add slightly more rice then recommended (1 1/3 cup) I would not recommend jasmine rice it completely breaks down to mush. White Long grain works best. I also increase the sugar slightly to 1 1/4 cup. Make sure you keep it covered while simmering that hour and stir frequently . I grate fresh nutmeg as well as cinnamon on top.
I always baked my rice pudding so this recipe intrigued me. It was üëç wonderful. I put mine in two separate square glass containers and put raisins in one.
very nice recipe, very good , and easy to make
Best rice pudding ever!
I absolutely love this recipe! Made it a few times and everyone loved it! Thank You so much for sharing.
Followed this letter by letter. Ended up very runny. I was expecting creamy. Tasted fine just wasn't the texture I expected.

So stinking delicious! I used more cinnamon, and added it to the milk/sugar/rice combination, just be cause I love it and wanted to get it layering the flavors. But whether or not you do that, the texture of this rice pudding is heavenly.
This was good, rinse the rice, cook the milk mixture until it starts to boil, then add the rice...I cooked just for an hour on low simmer...don't cook w/raisins, put them in afterwards.

I made this for the first time today. The flavor is terrific and the texture is great. I have an electric stove, and Step 2, cooking after adding the egg mixture, took much longer than 2 minutes. All in all though, very easy and great results.
I made it as it says. It wasn‚Äôt hard at all. It is cooling now and then in the fridge over night. I did try it and it was delicious. Just enough sweetness and creamy. Rice came out perfect.
I put Raisins in.
Liked
my new love!

Very tasty. I enjoyed it warm. I refrained from adding the egg and used 1/4 cup of heavy whipping cream at the end in lieu of the extra milk which made it a little creamier. Definitely making this again.

We were patient. It sat on the stove well over an hour steaming away. All we made was soup with rice that never really absorbed the liquid. Maybe this would work with some of the modification suggested by the other comments, but as written, this is nothing like what was promised!

The flavor is yummy. The instructions in the recipe will get you a soupy texture. Once you add the egg mixture, it takes longer than the 2 minutes to let the egg mixture actually do its job. I followed the recipe to a T since I haven't much experience with puddings. I was disappointed when it was still soupy the next day, however, I read some other reviewers and realized I might just need to heat it back up and let it thicken...I did and it came out perfect. Very tasty!
Perfect and easy using just regular milk

My end results were milk soup with rice in it, though the taste was really good it was a total disappointment. I followed the recipe exactly as stated. I had high hopes it would thicken in the fridge overnight but did not. Then I attempted to salvagebut could not eat it.
It was great, will make it again. I used Jasmine Rice, and it was really good.

I followed the recipe exactly....1/2 gal. milk & 1 Cup of Rice. I questioned this ratio in my mind before I made the recipe but I thought you knew what you were doing. I wound up with a 9 x 13 pan of milk soup with a few grains of rice floating around in it. What a total waste of time!
They look delicious.

I want to make this adding cinnamon sticks & grated orange rind. I believe I‚Äôll go nuts & substitute heavy cream & some orange juice for the plain milk. I worked in a diner that made orange cinnamon Rice Pudding & it was great. Some recipes call for dabs of butter. Mine will be a delicious heart attack desert. I‚Äôll let you all know how it comes out!

This didn‚Äôt work well for me. I followed the recipe as written except the timing on the stove. It took almost 2 hours to thicken the milk, rice, and sugar. The flavor was good but the texture was offputting and not enough rice in the finished pudding.

I split the 1/2 gallon of milk into 1/4 cup milk and 1/4 cup half and half and added an extra egg yolk for and even creamier custardy pudding. Many recipes I‚Äôve seen use a double boiler with precooked rice. The best way is too cool the rice in the milk. Don‚Äôt be shy about going a little longer than an hour but stir frequently! Scalded milk flavor is not good. I also like to add lemon peel to the simmer (remove before you cool the pudding).

FABULOUS rice pudding recipe! Only the second time I‚Äôve ever made Rice Pudding. This is a keeper for sure! I used whole milk with 1 pint half and half (ran out of milk). I cooked a 3‚Äù cinnamon stick with the milk/rice in my heavy stainless pot. I added a 4th egg as someone recommended but I think it may be too much. I‚Äôll use 3 next round. No problem sticking until last 10‚Äù. Turned out a little thick so I thinned it with a little canned milk (ran out of 1/2 & 1/2)!
Love this recipe. Today, I made it with blueberries, and used almond extract and nutmeg for seasoning. Stellar! I usually skip the eggs.
I made it with leftover already cooked white rice and it turned out great! I always add extra vanilla. I will definately make it again.
I‚Äôve made this several times. You do have to thicken while cooking though. It will not thicken when it cools
Best rice pudding ever!

I always make rice pudding with great success stove top so when I saw this I thought I‚Äôll try it-but was very disappointed by the outcome. I plugged in my crockpot at 11:30 and 5 1/2 hours later set to low the rice was still not completely cooked. I will just stick to my stove top method it‚Äôs always 100%
Creamy. Good recipe to use for extra milk you do not want to toss. I put cinnamon in while simmering stringer flavor with a tiny splash of real vanilla

I wanted rice pudding but didn't really want to pay attention to it. As I was reading the reviews I saw that some folks made in crockpot. Jackpot!! So I made on high for about 4hrs & used 1 egg as others suggested. I also only used 1 cup of sugar as it was sweet enough for me. I also stirred every 15 minutes first hour then after that about every 30 minutes. I honestly didn't know if I should but did anyway & it came out delicious. This is a keeper.

The only reason I rated 4 stars is because I feel nothing is perfect......everything can be improved upon. Aside from that, as the Italians say, ECCELLENTE! 
I followed the recipe written only taking advice from few reviewers: 1. Warming the milk before adding the sugar & rice. 2. Bringing the egg mixture to room temp. before combining with the pudding. I dashed a splash of nutmeg to the egg mixture as well. It was definitely quite tedious monitoring the pudding (for 1.5hrs on my stove) but as others had said, WELL WORTH IT. It is now chilling in the fridge for tonight's dessert. 
Thank you to our creator!
Loved this recipe. I did make it 2 times. The first time the rice didn't seem to cook all the way. The second time, I par cooked rice for only 4 mins and then continued with the recipe. Delish!!!

Made it as written and I will make it again. Rice pudding has been a traditional dessert for our Christmas Eve meal and I've never been a fan. But I tried this recipe and I actually like it a lot! It has a "custardy" feel to it, but it dishes up in a bowl like our previous attempts.

Made it as written and I will make it again. Rice pudding has been a traditional dessert for our Christmas Eve meal and I've never been a fan. But I tried this recipe and I actually like it a lot! It has a "custardy" feel to it, but it dishes up in a bowl like our previous attempts.

Made this in the crock pot as other suggested. Added a cinnamon stick and a dash of nutmeg in with rice and other ingredients. Used Mexican vanilla in place of the regular vanilla and added dried cranberries and ground cinnamon once it was done. The hubs loved it!

This rice pudding is so addictive. The Mother of ALL rice puddings. I‚Äôve made this recipe as written twice. Other times since, I‚Äôve added a little bit of real butter. I always use whole milk. Some helpful notes I picked up in other reviews:
-Bring milk/sugar to a soft boil, then add rice. 
-set a timer to stir every 10 minutes. 
-I don‚Äôt put the lid fully on, just leave it cracked open a bit so no boiling over
-as it thickens, I set timer and stir every 4 mins
-I probably cook it like this about an hour and a half
-when it‚Äôs the consistency I‚Äôm happy with, I take it off the burner for 10 minutes to cool slightly
-then I add the eggs, milk, cinnamon, vanilla and butter

For my next trick, I‚Äôm adding cardamom. Or Nutmeg. Or maybe allspice? 

I might even experiment with adding an extra egg. I LOVE the rich custard-like consistency of this. It‚Äôs amazing warm or cold. 

I never will eat any other rice pudding again. They are all inferior to this one, I promise you this.

Made this for a dinner party with a couple of girlfriends and making it in the crockpot was the BOMB!! So easy! I used a crockpot liner and did add the extra 1/3 cup sugar as another reviewer suggested and also put in cinnamon sticks while it cooked on low overnight. Added 1cup of raisins and topped each serving with whipped cream and a sprinkle of sugar/cinnamon blend. We all loved it!! Will make this again for sure. Thank you for sharing the recipe!
I had 2 boxes of cooked white rice from leftover Chinese food. I used them both and this recipe worked well with it!!
It‚Äôs my only rice pudding recipe!!!!

I think the flavor is great. I made it the first time following the recipe, started the 1hour after it came to a boil. I even cooked it about 10 mins longer. Omitted cinnamon. Used Abborrio Rice for creamy results. I used 2% milk. Even with additional cook time, it was runny. I made it a second time and continued to follow recipe instead this time I used 1 heaping cup of long grain white rice and 1 cup Abborrio Rice. I pulled the 1/4 cup milk from the half gallon, rather than in addition to. After I cooked it the 1 hour after reaching boiling, it was very thick. I pulled about a cup or so out into a bowl and mixed in the 1/4 cup milk, 3 beaten eggs, vanilla, splash of salt. Then incorporate that mixture into the rest of the pan. Came out great!! Perfect consistency. Again skipped cinnamon. The flavor is great and I'm anxious to see after it chills overnight if it still has a great taste and has not gotten pasty.

Made the pudding tonight, incorporating Angela‚Äôs changes, wish I could give it a higher rating, it‚Äôs delicious warm, can‚Äôt wait till tomorrow to try it once refrigerated. Only way to make true rice pudding is to cook the rice in milk. Yum, yum!
I added some almond extract also.instant rice after it was done cooking. I like mine with lots of rice.
Deliciously creamy. Very easy to make. It was a hit with my family and neighbors.

This recipe is delicious and very forgiving of substitutes! I'm dairy intolerant so the first time I made this with rice milk and it turned out perfectly with no other adjustments. The second time I tried it with almond milk, which has a lower fat content, and found that it needed much longer cooking time, so I'd recommend cutting back the amount of almond milk by perhaps a whole cup. I also used coconut sugar on my second try for a healthier alternative with a richer taste. I imagine playing around with the sugars (i.e. half brown, half white, or some sugar replacements) would work out as well.

ProTip: If you underestimated how much cooking time the pudding needed and it didn't thicken up enough in the fridge, just throw the 9x13 pan in the oven at 250*F for a couple hours, stirring occasionally. This will help the excess liquid evaporate without overcooking the pudding.

This recipe is great, although it does need some changes! I have listed them below...
1. I use 2% milk which cooks and tastes great! I'm sure any type of milk would be great, although I find I make the best rice pudding using 2% milk.
2. I use 1 1/4 - 1/2 cups rice. The first time I tried this recipe with only 1 cup, it did not turn into rice pudding as there was too much of a gap between the milk to rice ratio. 
**NOTE** this is also preference. If you like your rice pudding more or less dense, add rice accordingly. To make a standard rice pudding though, about 1 1/4 cup rice should be fine.
**NOTE 2** As you are watching the rice pudding, you can add or take away rice until the last 10 minute mark (just dont take or put in too much!)
3. Time varies a lot!! I have made this recipe both in 1 hour, 2 hours, etc. You have to look at the rice pudding and wait until it thickens to let it sit for 10 minutes and then add the rest of the mixture! Be patient! If it is taking a long time, increase the heat slightly but watch it carefully!
4. I always put the heat slightly more towards medium heat. I think this makes for the right consistency. Along with this though, you have to be more watchful over the pudding to ensure the milk doesn't burn or the rice doesn't stick to the bottom.

Overall, this is a great recipe! It is a hit amongst my entire family! 

Happy baking! :)

I used Vanilla Almond milk to make this and Whipping cream for the last step. Gave it a very sweet richness.
Also 60 minutes is a LOL for the first step.
To get as thick as it should be takes at least 1 3/4 hrs. 
Remember you are stirring a lot so you are uncovering the pot so it takes longer.
Good recipe
Smooth and creamy and almond milk works great but make the sugar less.
Too much in the directions way too sweet.
Should not be.

I made this (first time ever making rice pudding). I followed a tagged suggestion and added 1 more egg. It also said to cook to the point of thickness desired. Being afraid to cook it too long and get eggs- I made a slurry of cornstarch and the hot milk and thickened it with that along with extra cook time. It turned out wonderful!

I‚Äôve made this several times and it is great each time. I found Neilly‚Äôs Coconut rice mix and used it in place of the rice. Gave it a hint of coconut flavor. I also use half and half in place of the last milk (I visit my mom once a month and make her two batches of rice pudding ‚Äî this way I only need to buy one gallon of milk). Yum to the max!
This is really creamy, as advertised. Very tasty. I made it with 1% milk and added a cinnamon stick to the rice mixture as it cooked.

Absolutely Delicious! I've been wanting rice pudding but with so many recipes on here, which one to try? I always read the reviews first and when I saw that others made this in the crockpot, I thought, how much easier does it get? I followed the ingredients "as is". I warmed the milk (I used skim as that's what we drink) on the stove, just until barely warm. I then put it in the crockpot with one cup of long grain rice and the sugar. Truth be told, I did add another 1/3 c. of sugar. I set the crockpot in high and stirred every 30-45 minutes. I checked it in 3 hours and there was still a lot of liquid in the pot so let it go another 1 1/2 hours on the Low setting. At this time I beat 3 eggs and tempered the eggs with pouring a 1/2 cup of the hot milk in with the eggs before adding to the rice mixture. I also added the vanilla and salt at this time. Let it cook another 20 minutes and it was thick and yummy. So easy, no pot to watch. The milk didn't burn on. I will definitely fall back on this recipe anytime I get the desire for rice pudding again. Oh, I added the cinnamon at the very end. Delicious!

I have Made this for Years, 
Follow the Recipe Exactly, and You Won't Have Problems, once you change or substitute, your going to have problems
This is Absolutely the Best Rice Pudding Recipe Anywhere ?? ?? ??

My son gave this a 4:2 star...he is the rice pudding fan and wanted me to try a new recipe.he loved this! Nice and creamy! No substitutes but took one persons advice to bring the egg mixture to room temp.
This recipe is extra yummy if you substitute 1 cup of real maple syrup for the 1 cup of sugar! Mmmmmm!

Total disaster. As others stated - rice soup. Way too much milk. I hesitated when I first saw that, but continued based on the star rating and number of reviews. Salvaged it somewhat by adding a corn starch mixture after reheating it the next day. Still pretty good. Probably won't try again, though, unless someone can tell me why so many had a near perfect experience and others a total disaster.

I love it! I followed the instructions as listed but did include the tips in the reviews. I added the extra egg as well as began my 1 hour cook time once the mixture began simmering. I will definitely be making this again. It was just like my grandmother's.
I made the rice pudding and it came out great! I was worried because I used almond milk instead of whole milk, but it still tasted delicious.

Absolutely delicious. I was out of eggs, so I used flaxseeds to make an egg substitute. It worked perfectly and gave the rice a nutty component. I cut the sugar by about 1/3 and I also added cardamon pods, cloves and cinnamon sticks to the milk/sugar/rice mixture, removing them before adding the ‚Äúegg‚Äù mixture. This recipe is definitely a keeper.

Very delicious! However, it does require additional cooking time. Plan on 1 1/2 hrs before adding eggs. I also used 4 eggs as another reviewer mentioned along with some nutmeg, just because I like this spice. It‚Äôs worth the time for this old fashioned treat.

Would be helpful if you stated the 1/2 gallon of milk is a U.S.A gallon or a Canadian gallon, as there's a big difference. Or in cupss like everything else is. Otherwise it's good, but I had to figure out the ratios.
This recipe is exactly what I was looking for. It is awesome
This recipe is so easy and is delicious! I tripled it to serve 40 people at the nursing home that I work at. It was delicious!
I loved this recipe but i didn't leave it to cool for 8 hours instead i let t cool for 5 hours. VERY DELICIOUS and this is my day off meal for now on.
Better than my favorite restaurants rice pudding!! My family loved it!! Followed the recipe as written. This is my new go to rice pudding recipe.
I followed the recipe as is, the only thing I did was to cook the egg mixture for more than 2 minutes. I cooked it until desired thickness
Followed the crock pot recipe and it is excellent! Thick, creamy, and flavorful. Will definitely make again.

I should have read the reviews first before making this recipe. I went exactly by the recipe, but mine didn't get thick enough. It's not real runny, but not the consistency I wanted it to be. I lost my Mother's recipe from years ago, but remember how thick it was. I don't know if I can put it back in the pan and cook it longer or what. It's been in the refrigerator all night, and I too, thought somehow that would thicken it up. Tastes good, and I added raisins.

This recipe needs tweaking, but the end results are great. Here‚Äôs what I did...
1 1/2 cup rice
8 cups milk
1/3 cup sugar

1/4 cup milk
3 eggs
5 teaspoons vanilla extract
1/4 teaspoon salt

I increased the temperature a little and had it on the stovetop for about 1 1/2 hours, stirring it every 10 minutes or so. The trick is that you need to continue to have it on the stovetop until you can see the mixture getting denser/ heavier. If you do that, the recipe turns out great!!! A huge hit in my household!!!!!
Awesome!!
The pudding is delicious! Next time, I‚Äôll use less sugar as it is too sweet for me.
Perhaps I did something incorrectly but it turned out very liquidy . I wouldn't recommend.
Holy moly this is delicious! I had to have a bowl without chilling it first and man it was so good!
Love this recipe

I have gone through dozens of recipes trying to find one that was close to the diner and Italian deli style of rice pudding that I grew up with in New York. This is not only close, it is almost exact! Followed the recipe, apart from starting with all ingredients at room temperature. Did follow the crockpot recommendations of others, and it makes this recipe practically foolproof. This is going to become a staple dessert at our house, no doubt.
I finally found the perfect rice pudding recipe! My grandmother used to make rice pudding for me; I loved it. This comes the closest to my grandmother's recipe. Delicious!

This was delicious, but I did change it a bit: I first soaked a cup of raisins in about a cup of Salted Caramel Bailey's , per a suggestion to soak raisins in liquor. Then for the pudding, I combined one can of sweetened condensed milk, about a half pint of half and half, and whole milk, to get to the half gallon needed. Because of the addition of sweetened condensed milk, I reduced the sugar to about 1/3 cup. I also added a stick of cinnamon. I then started out cooking in the crock pot, per many suggestions, but it was not getting to the right temp to thicken quickly enough for me ( I was bringing it to my sister's that day), so I put it all in the pressure cooker and set to the "rice" setting. I tempered the egg mixture with 1/2 cup rice mixture before adding, then added the liquor soaked raisins, and kept pressure cooker on low for another 20 minutes or so. It was a little bit thinner than I wanted, but it did thicken up a bit after sitting and then chilling. When it was ready, I served with a dash or two of Penzey's cinnamon blend and whipped cream. HEAVEN! Everyone thought the addition of the Bailey's soaked raisins was awesome. The only thing I would do different next time is maybe reduce milk by about a cup and do it in the pressure cooker to begin with.
My new potluck favorite! Really creamy and beautiful. Teensiest bit too sweet for me, will cut sugar by 1/3 next time. Used low fat milk and added 1T butter at end. Thanks for posting!

I honestly can‚Äôt foresee anyone making this as described and having it be successful. The amount of rice is way too low, if you only use 1 cup, you‚Äôll end up with vanilla pudding with a few lumps of rice in it. I used closer to 2 and even that seemed low in the end. For sure use 2 and even 2.5 would be better. I added a cinnamon stick to the mixture as it simmered away.

mmmmm...yummy! I brought the rice, milk and sugar to a boil, then turned to low and covered and stirred occasionally to avoid sticking. I left the egg/ milk mixture out for the hour and then added about a cup of the hot rice into the egg mixture to temper then added it back into the rice. This is SO creamy! And its sweet but not overly sweet. Love it! I just put it into a bowl, hot, sprinkled cinnamon over and put a plastic wrap on the top of the pudding and refrigerated overnight.
Love it! So yummy! Follow the recipe and it'll turn out great! Love it so much! This was my third time to make rice pudding and I love this recipe

I think there is a typo in the instructions which indicates to cook 2 min after adding the egg mixture. After setting overnight, I still had a pan full on liquid. I actually put it back in a pan & Cooked over medium heat, stirring steadily for about 20 min., as with other puddings. The mixture thickened & came to a slight bubbling, and was done. It did set almost immediately & was delicious! I see others had the same issue.
Yummy! I took it to a luncheon and got many compliments. I did have to cook it longer to get it to the consistency I wanted. But, just keep cooking till you get it where you want.

Used skim milk. Started in the slow cooker but mixture had not budged after 3 hours on high. So I transferred to a pot and it went well from there! I cooked until thickened. I used the 3 eggs (room temp, added hot rice/milk mix into eggs first before combining into big pot). It is definitely creamy, almost custard, so 1 or 2 eggs may be sufficient. Added more vanilla. Thanks! Very similar to the restaurant style I was trying to recreate!

I've used this recipe dozens of times. It's just perfect! Three years ago we moved to a new house - - - and lost the recipe. I was crestfallen. I've torn my house apart looking for this recipe. I've done a number of internet searches as well. Today I found you, on the 12th page of my search. Should have gone to allrecipes.com in the first place. Tomorrow I'll be making rice pudding.
love this recipe any one that has tasted it loves it . made this one at least twenty times

I worked for many years at a family restaurant that made delicious homemade rice pudding almost daily. The only problem was, the quantities were so great that it was hard to scale it back for a normal family. when I saw this recipe, I was definitely intrigued. I was skeptical that only one cup of rice and a 1/2 gallon of milk would work. I read the reviews and was able to get some really good advice. So 5 stars for the recipe and 5 stars for those who posted helpful hints. Totally a success!
I made this. And it is the best and easiest recipe. I had to make a second batch of this rice pudding because I ate the whole first batch.
Recipe was easy to make once I was able to control the temperature of the electric stove as boil overs were becoming a headache. Wonderful and creamy, definitely a favorite!

Delicious.

I will make it again for sure. I used short grain rice, which to me is the right thing for pudding, but I doubt it makes a great deal of difference. I skipped the cinnamon (I can decide for each portion whether I'd rather have plain vanilla, or add cinnamon to it then.) I used a bit less sugar, which for me is the whole point of making it myself.

As usual for these recipes, the actual time it took was more than the recipe said. An hour and 15 minutes did not allow enough time to bring such a large quantity of ingredients up to temperature.

To my mind, I followed the cooking directions exactly, but in reading some of the reviews, I can see that not enough information was given. To whit:

The recipe says to heat under medium low heat. Simmer for an hour. So the hour starts after you get it to the boiling point. Given the ingredients, I stirred constantly (but actually had it at a bit higher heat) while bringing it to temperature. Once simmering begins, it takes a very low heat to simmer something covered -- so I would never expect to keep it on "medium low", even though the recipe didn't say to reduce the heat.

At the end... I see the recipe did not make this clear at all, but, eggs are not going to help set anything unless you actually cook them. The 2 minutes of cooking starts after the pudding is brought back up to temperature.

I did find that mine continued to thicken exactly as I would expect. (But then, that involves having a good feel for what to expec
Reminds me of the kind my mother used to make. The only difference with hers , is that she would add a few lemon rinds.

I followed this recipe almost to the tee!! I used one reviewers suggestion which was to cook the pudding 80 minutes instead of one hour! It made a huge difference in the thickness I preferred for my pudding. Otherwise, everything else I followed as written!
